details:
* [CVE-2014-9705](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-9705)
Heap-based buffer overflow in the enchant\_broker\_request\_dict
 function in ext/enchant/enchant.c in PHP before 5.4.38, 5.5.x
 before 5.5.22, and 5.6.x before 5.6.6 allows remote attackers
 to execute arbitrary code via vectors that trigger creation of
 multiple dictionaries.
* [CVE-2015-0232](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-0232)
The exif\_process\_unicode function in ext/exif/exif.c in PHP
 before 5.4.37, 5.5.x before 5.5.21, and 5.6.x before 5.6.5
 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a
 denial of service (uninitialized pointer free and application
 crash) via crafted EXIF data in a JPEG image.
* [CVE-2015-2301](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-2301)
Use-after-free vulnerability in the phar\_rename\_archive function
 in phar\_object.c in PHP before 5.5.22 and 5.6.x before 5.6.6
 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly
 have unspecified other impact via vectors that trigger an attempted
 renaming of a Phar archive to the name of an existing file.
* [CVE-2015-2331](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-2331)
Integer overflow in the \_zip\_cdir\_new function in zip\_dirent.c
 in libzip 0.11.2 and earlier, as used in the ZIP extension in PHP
 before 5.4.39, 5.5.x before 5.5.23, and 5.6.x before 5.6.7 and
 other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
 service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code
 via a ZIP archive that contains many entries, leading to a
 heap-based buffer overflow.
* [CVE-2015-2783](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-2783)
Buffer Over-read in unserialize when parsing Phar
* [CVE-2015-2787](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-2787)
Use-after-free vulnerability in the process\_nested\_data function
 in ext/standard/var\_unserializer.re in PHP before 5.4.39, 5.5.x
 before 5.5.23, and 5.6.x before 5.6.7 allows remote attackers to
 execute arbitrary code via a crafted unserialize call that
 leverages use of the unset function within an \_\_wakeup function,
 a related issue to [CVE-2015-0231](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-0231).
* [CVE-2015-3329](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-3329)
Buffer Overflow when parsing tar/zip/phar in phar\_set\_inode
* [CVE-2015-3330](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-3330)
PHP potential remote code execution with apache 2.4 apache2handler

* CVE-2015-temp-68819

 Denial of service when processing a crafted file with Fileinfo
